history.content:
I really wouldn't recommend this. EE127 and Stat134 (/EE126) are at least unofficial prereqs for CS189, and individually they're already difficult and a lot of work. CS189 is personally the hardest class I've taken at Cal, so trying to take it at the same time as both of its prereqs sounds miserable. If you don't absolutely have to take 189 this semester I'd really recommend waiting until Spring. 

----------

Actually 54 + 70 is enough for 189. The homework & lectures will teach you every linear algebra you need for 189 (PSD matrix, quadratic form, SVD), and the only thing 134 goes beyond 70 is continuous probability, which is rarely used in 189. You can just take 189 and no need to take 127 or 134.

----------

I don't agree with above answer. It completely depends on who is teaching 189 and what topics are covered

I really wouldn't recommend this. EE127 and Stat134 (/EE126) are at least unofficial prereqs for CS189, and individually they're already difficult and a lot of work. CS189 is personally the hardest class I've taken at Cal, so trying to take it at the same time as both of its prereqs sounds miserable. If you don't absolutely have to take 189 this semester I'd really recommend waiting until Spring.

children.subject: Completely agree with above post, no reason to do this

Thank you for you detailed response.

What I mean by survive is will I pass, and will my mental health not be decimated?

I am interested in going to grad school, so worrying about gpa is one thing I am concerned about. However, I also am a rising senior who switched his major in college and had to play catch up on requisite classes. Now going into my final year with the freedom to take classes I actually want to take, I want to make the most of it. The reason why I'm trying to take cs189 while arguably having a shaky foundation is because I want to be able to take two courses before I graduate in the spring (i am talking about Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision. They need cs189 as a prerequisite). So while I don't have the time to take these classes to prepare for this semester, I'm thinking even if these courses won't have been taken in time to give a good foundation for 189, I am hoping they will provide one for the courses I will take in the spring. 

Thoughts?
Did you even read the student response lol? Just take 189 without the other two and put all your effort towards that.

I’m not sure about the mental health issue. Have to respect that everyone has different life goals and situations to consider. But it definitely will be a tough semester. Lower your workload a little bit and preview the material now is also a wise choice. Good luck!

To the Anonymous two replies above, thank you for your input. I did read the student response. If you read my response to the original reply above carefully, I clarified that I'm not taking eecs127 and stat 134 purely for the sake of preparing for 189. I am hoping it would at the very least give me a foundation for the following spring semester for the courses I named: cs280 (computer vision) and cs288 (nlp). If you have some experience or knowledge of the material covered in the courses, and can advise me on how useful eecs 127 and stat 134 would be for them, I would love to hear your thoughts on that! But please don't give me attitude like that again. There's no need to be rude bro. I'm just worried for this semester and wanted to ask for advice from you guys :)

I would think about the possibility you would be doing yourself a disservice by overloading yourself. These classes are very tough, and for me personally, I know overloading myself would just result in my not learning and deeply understanding everything I could have from those classes due to spreading myself thin. But, good luck dude!

The answer depending on how u define “survive”. Do u mean finishing those classes with at least passing grades(C-) as “survived” or ur expectation about “survive” now is higher. If it’s the former one, yeah u can “survive”. I once took CS61B(hilfinger) CS70 EECS126 and math 191 in one semester and went through that semester with average gpa 3.1. I think I “survived” and built up some sort of mental toughness when encountering adversities. But I understand it might be a catastrophe for many students to have a C+ on the transcript for many future purposes(grad school, jobs, etc...) Based on your description, u already got strong willpower and mental toughness. So, I would suggest u now to spend more time building up foundations and knowledge. And then challenge the harder ones with ur mental toughness, I’m sure you will gain more. For detailed suggestions, if u got plenty time, do stat140/eecs126 + math110 first(also watch 3Blue1brown linear algebra intuition along the way, it might change your intuition about linear algebra forever!). Then take eecs127 either before CS189 or take both in the same semester depending on how confident you are about your fundamentals.

history.content:
Hello, 

I'm planning on taking cs189, eecs127 and stat 134 together this coming fall semester. I barely survived/passed cs61c, cs170 and data 100 last semester, but tbh my study habits were extremely poor. In terms of background, I have taken math 54/ee16a, cs70 and cs188. In addition, this summer I have been cultivating my willpower and thus have the strength to refuse to give up this coming semester. Given these factors, is this schedule survivable?
history.subject: Will I survive? CS189 + EECS127 + Stat 134
